reviews.review: Such a cute game. I love the decorations, characters and music. The story is so fun too. Would love to see this game expanded in the future!
Amazing cozy game, really enjoyed playing this.

One of the best games ive played for a while, I love the cozy vibe it brings and felt very stress free. I played unpacking on xbox and this reminds me of it but with so much more! The plot was interesting and I found the anomalies part cool and a good extra bit for the game. Def want to see more games like this!!! 10/10

Super fun! If you love unpacking, this is a great game similar to the style of unpacking with the isometric pixel graphics and gameplay. It's not just unpacking either, there's tons of content where you can buy homes or showrooms to furnish with what you find through gameplay as well. If you're a sims 4/house flipper/any furnishing game then you'll definitely like that aspect of freedom too. Lots of variety, lots of challenges, plenty of content. The story is cute, the localization is fine (devs are chinese - the game has plenty of chinese culture referenced in it, but also has seasonal decor from other cultures worldwide. the dia de los muertos stuff was a pleasant surprise lmao) 
highly, highly, highly recommend. the price of the game compared to the content is absolutely stellar!
Such a fun little game! Like Unpacking but a little bit more story and secrets
Very fun casual game with some neat puzzles

Très chill pour jouer après une longue journée de travail ou juste une journée où on a pas d'énergie.
Le jeu est beau, le système de missions est très cool.

요즘 어떤 게임을 해도 흥미가 안 생기고 뭔가 정신 놓고 하게 되는 게임이 없었는데,
그런 노잼시기인 저에게 찾아온 너무 재미있고 귀여운 게임이에요ଘ(´•3•)⊃━☆

언패킹 느낌에 정리 게임이지만 더욱 자유도가 높고 아이템과 방도 훨씬 많아서 더 재미있어요
  정가 주고 구매했는데도 돈이 전혀 아깝지 않고 오히려 이 정도에 이 가격이 엄청 저렴하다고 느낄 정도였어요

한글 패치가 없는 게임이라 인터넷에 유저 패치를 다운로드하면 된다는데 굳이 안 해도 게임에 지장 없을 정도인 가벼운 영어들이 많아요

숨은 이스터에그도 많고 아이템들도 많으니 다들 열심히 찾아보시고 재미있는 시간 보내세요( ˆ͈̑꒳ˆ͈̑ )੭♡
BOM DEMAISSS tinha que ter um bilhão de horas de duração
好玩爱玩

特别喜欢这个游戏里一些很细节的地方，爷爷的家里画在置物搁板上的涂鸦，搪瓷盆和床头的假牙，几乎让我回忆起小时候老家房间的味道。海边小屋那章也非常喜欢，勾起了一些童年回忆。总体来看是很放松的温馨小游戏，喜欢像素风所以买来玩的。在房屋布置的基础玩法上加入了一些新的玩法和小互动、小故事，还埋藏了一个秘密来引起玩家的兴趣，很好的避免了枯燥。对自己房间的布置自由度很高，物品很多，做的很细，每一件都有一句话介绍，想起小时候玩的皮卡堂，如果你有在长大后试图重玩4399来追忆童年，最终无功而返，推荐你试试这款游戏。
super fun cozy puzzle and organization.  Heavy emphasis on decorating.
好玩

This is such a cozy game for me! It combined the unboxing game and decorating homes, try to figure out the weird things around the city. I played 4 hours stray and still have not done with it yet! A lot of varieties of furniture around the map that you can roll for by using voucher, which is so easy to get! Highly recommend this game!!
总体游玩下来体验还是很不错的，但是主线任务太短了，感觉还玩不够。要是有主题家具就更棒了
不推荐
somehow soothing
像素风就是yyds，萌萌的

I seriously love this game! There's so much cute furniture, love the little story lines, really good mechanics. Literally nothing bad to say! The main storyline is pretty short, but after you can still decorate all the houses you want basically. I'm so obsessed I just want more!!

If you liked Unpacking, you'll like this! Gorgeous art direction, cozy organizing gameplay, and lots of cute and funny dialogue. 

Only critique I would have would be I didn't care for the few times you had to place items in exact places. Felt more like being ordered around instead of being able to make my own organization decisions.
不多说，上时长，虽然可能因为我是重度家装爱好者的原因，但是还是要说，分类更新就是最伟大的更新

とてもいいチルゲーです。ストアページの画像からわかるとおり、ドット絵の良さは素晴らしいです。かなりの数のアイテムがキレイなドットで作りこまれていますし、街並みも非常に雰囲気が良いです。
ストーリーもちょうどいい塩梅です。

When the creators of Unpacking said they had no intention of making a follow up game, I was stung. This game soothed that burn. It's relaxed, comforting, and highly interactive. I beat the main story and still have some little areas to work on, which I fully intend to do. I deeply enjoyed this game. With that being said, yes I'm going to be that person. It would have been nice to have a customized character. There really isn't a reason why we have to choose between two genders and one skin tone in 2025. It could have just been pick the body frame, pick the skin tone, pick the hair, and be done with it. That was my only hang up with this game. That, and a tiny bit more guidance could have been given.  However, this game easily paid for itself.
Super duper cute!!! Entertaining as hell, fun missions, super engaging, interesting stories and lore, super fun gameplay! Absolutely recommend, I've had a ton of fun with this game, love it! <333

A small but excellent game. You furnish apartments and discover curious things along the way. It's not very extensive, but it's a lot of fun and good for achievement hunters. The pixel graphics are really cute.
THE BEST GAME SINCE UNPACKING
画风非常好看。在预计游戏时间内也不会觉得腻。单纯想玩装修的小伙伴可以入

love this game, its so easy to just get lost playing it. I didn't really like unpacking as it felt pointless but this feels really nice with the questing and roaming around  you can do would for sure recommend
Gorgeous gem of a game, can see this totally blowing up in the near future.
literalmente o melhor joguinho de arrumar casa, tem história, é LINDO e bem diverso

This game is ADORABLE ♥ 
>spooky little storyline 
>point and clicky adventure time 
>fun with rando loot box shops 
>nice that you can target-buy things from other shops 
>digging through trash is fun raccoon-sim 
>pet the cats! ♥ 
>can still do things after completing the storyline/game doesn't abruptly kick you out

Demasiado adictivo. Muchisima variedad de decoración, se te iran las horas volando si te gustan los juegos tranquilos.

I really hope the developer puts out DLC for this game because I absolutely loved everything about it, except for how short it was. I crave more fun mysteries to solve while decorating these little spaces. It felt so satisfying to clean up the messes and discover little easter eggs everywhere. I just want MORE, haha. Definitely check this game out and support them, and maybe we will get some kind of update or extra levels in the future~
Absolutely loved this game. The music and aesthetic has a comforting feel to it. Time went by so fast while I was playing. A very nice feel good game. Highly recommend.

The game has fun aspects to it. But I was disappointed by the frequent references to occultism. From the images of pentagrams to a random in game tarot card reading. I disagree with the ideology of occultism and it feels out of place in a game like this.

Cozy interior design game, you're free to set the rooms whatever way you want. Choice of items feel a little limited after some time, including interior layouts. Though the main story is quick to finish, it has a lot of replayability via the town notice board where you can accept (unlimited?) NPC requests to decorate showrooms. I think it still has a lot of room to expand on down the line, so it's worth the purchase even at full price.
非常好玩，适合摸鱼（QWQ）

A relaxing organiser game if you like cleaning, organising and decoration, but just not in your own house. 
Very hard recommend!
解压和暴躁 反复横跳
治愈解压非常好评
豪玩，很适合那种静下心来东跑跑，西走走的休闲玩家，装修很上头，就是给我的户型有点烂说实话，能不能给个超级大浴室，我要狠狠泡澡。
I love it

Awesome game for decorating and puzzles!

Very similar to Unpacking, though it's not as strict about where you put items. I am curious about the story line that is unraveling and the expansion of the characters' stories. I thought this would just be a simple puzzle game, but it appears to be more layered than that. I enjoy the music and the overall art style.

I was expecting a game more more like Unpacking, Whisper of the House is not that.
This game is much closer to something like decorating homes in The Sims or Animal Crossing's Happy Home Decorator. While I enjoyed the partial puzzle of figuring out how a set collection of furniture can fit together, about half of the game's runtime is "free build".

Being from a Chinese studio, there are some amusing quirks in game design. The only one I would consider a negative being paragraphs of flowery text. Unfortunately any impact the dialogue from characters have is lost in translation.
這個畫風和玩法挺不錯的，而且家具超級多，基本上都能弄出非常好看的設計佈置，唯一覺得可惜就是主線很短，而且劇情來說……結局有點失望（？）感覺前面鋪墊不少但不太連接……
Love it.
Fun, relaxing, and the end has an interesting twist that gives the game a story.
Chill and comfy game after a hard days work :D
Peak fiction

Pretty good light puzzle/unpacking game with exceptionally good art direction.

**MILD SPOILERS**
This game's "dark twist" for each house was probably originally meant to be a lot more realistic and true crime inspired. Based on the first case, but it pulled it back and went a lot more fantastical and light which I didn't like as much.

Still, really good game.

I wish there was a "Yes, but" kind of option on Steam. Game took me 8 hours to complete in full with all achievements. I opted to not go out and try to get all the collectible furniture. In the end, I wasn't as drawn to the designing aspect of each room as much as I was during Unpacking. The convenience stores felt very unsatisfying in particular because there didn't feel to be a good way to organize everything to my own satisfaction due to some of the pixel constraints. Not being able to put all the soda bottles in the fridge because only certain rows could double stack, etc.

This was a fun time, don't get me wrong. But I think Unpacking did the UI of this concept much better and with a more cohesive story line and didn't even use words.
I'm loving this game so far very relaxing and cute. It's definitely a game you can kick back with a hot drink and just enjoy playing
buenardopolis
very cute and different to the other unboxing games. Loved it. Definitely worth giving it a run through once...or twice

Very addictive and compelling at the outset but quickly tapers off into not really knowing what to do apart from indulging one's collectomania. There doesn't really feel like there's any uniting story behind all the "strange events" in town, nor adequate motivation to keep playing after finishing the main requests (which were fewer in number than I expected). All that said I did pour 12 numbed-out hours into this before I felt like there was nothing left for me, which is pretty good value for the sale price.

Gameplay, story, and writing felt half-baked. Still, very pretty pixel art for the city and interiors, with a staggering amount of furniture choices, so the game will still be fun for people who just want to decorate houses

i liked it. its cute and fun. for the price and the size of the map i was expecting a few more "levels"  but still fun and i can still fuck around and decorate if i want. it also sorta feels like they were setting up more with the story and like it being a "horror" game but  then it just sorta ends idk feels like there could be more. still cute and fun

不完全只有裝飾房間，還可以同時探索發現隱藏的房間或物品、瞭解居民的故事及生活（甚至偷用他們的東西XD），可以協助讓居民的生活過得更好甚至找回初心，是很治癒的遊戲。同時每樣物品都有說明，很用心，也喜歡區分主線跟支線（接案裝潢）的部份，沒有時間上的壓力，可以依據自己心情遊玩。
最後的結局其實有點搞不懂，但好希望可以再追加其他居民的故事！感覺玩了這款之後就回不去一般的裝飾遊戲了，因為這款真的打破裝飾遊戲玩一玩就膩的問題...

玩法很休闲放松，虽然打下来右手点击得有点抽筋了。画风很治愈，有很多我觉得挺有意思的细节，许多小家具都是可以互动的。比起日常样板间任务我还是更喜欢主线故事，尤其是爷爷，海边小屋和医院的故事。感觉每个任务塑造很简短但其实还是很用心的，高共情人士还是很容易被触动的。
个人感觉打到结局的内容量还是太短了，很喜欢这个游戏，打到终端结局有种怅然若失的感觉：啊？这样就结束了？官方我求你速端上来更新，续作也行。我将拥护你！！！！！
好玩

This is a really cute and cozy game. It's very relaxing to play, and has some beautiful art direction, animation, and music. There are some wonky parts to it- it isn't the most intuitive thing to play (I had to use a walk-through because the game doesn't explain much to you), and it does have some English localization issues (I can understand everything as a native English speaker, but I did have to read some things a few times to understand what the game meant). Overall, though, it is a pretty enjoyable game that clearly had a lot of love poured into it. It's a decent investment if you're looking to play a relatively short game that has some chill post-game content. I managed to beat the game in about eight hours of laid-back play, but I can still continue to play and decorate little houses.

Adorable little game that you can 100% in about 7 hours.
Very similar to unpacking- organize and clean rooms around town to progress through the story. Little-to-no replayability for me, personally, unless they add content or update the game. As a standalone, short solo-player game, though, it's very cute and worth playing through once.
was in desperate need of a new cozy game that wasn't just repeating some old favorites. this is cute and fun, and sometimes a little creepy. thank u for saving me, i was so thirsty
had so much fun playing this :)

There are a lot of items that are beautifully animated; makes it fun to interact with each object. The gacha elements to get various furniture also makes it more fun to collect them all. Some darker elements in the game were a bit unexpected, although they contribute to its uniqueness. In overall, a cute & cozy game to play & decorate to your heart's content!
有点无聊

[b] Jogo inacreditavelmente bom - com “segredos” que fazem o universo realmente se expandir e despertam a ânsia de jogar cada vez mais. [/b]

[i] Whisper of the House [/i] é um jogo point and click de decoração, organização e “tarefas”, em que cada atividade ajuda a montar a história dos moradores da cidade, enquanto o próprio ambiente conta sua narrativa através das ruas, casas e becos.
Com um cenário interativo e cheio de detalhes, é fácil perceber o quanto o [b] GD Studio [/b] coloca carinho em seus projetos - visível em cada pixel e linha de código. Isso, na minha opinião, torna o jogo profundo e cria uma atmosfera acolhedora, que faz o jogador se sentir parte daquela história.

Joguei por 10 horas até platinar, e com certeza vou continuar por muito mais tempo graças ao alto fator de replay. Mesmo após o fim da história principal, a rejogabilidade permanece praticamente intacta - o jogo parece te chamar para continuar explorando, testando cores, mobílias e combinações de decoração. É [i] surrealmente [/i] divertido e relaxante.

[quote=Whisper of the House] May the light never fade, and your kindness remain forever. [/quote]

[h1]ネタバレありで不便に思った点を書きます[/h1]
謎解きがわかりづらい…2番目に書いたことと共通してきます。
海外のスタジオ製なのでsteam内ガイドも外国語で幾度となく翻訳とにらめっこしてました。一応全実績も解除しましたので海外の有志の方々に感謝。
特に分からなかったのは[spoiler] 花の交配や[/spoiler]実績にもある[spoiler] パンをオーブンで焼いたり[/spoiler]することがなかなか見つからなかったです。
またクリア後に探索して[spoiler]コーディネートする家[/spoiler]を見つけないといけないところもあって大変でした。
アップデートで緩和されたり追加要素が出たりするのを待っています。家具ももっとほしい！DLCほしいです🙏🙏🙏

cozy organization game

I’m a Korean player who’s been truly enjoying this game!
The charming pixel art, detailed sound design, and the joy of placing various decorations have completely captivated me.

Thank you so much for creating such a delightful experience! 💕
I’d like to make a gentle suggestion — since Whisper of the House is a game where emotions and story details matter a lot, reading the item descriptions feels like an important part of the fun.

If Korean language support could be added in the future, I believe Korean players — myself included — would be able to enjoy the game even more deeply and immersively.

Thank you again for this wonderful game! I truly love it 🌸

I love this game so much! It's similar to Unpacking where you help people unpack, organize, and decorate. I love the pixel art style and the secrets you can find all over the town. The tiny cats you can pet are super cute too. Some of the town folks you help also have really interesting stories.

This game has everything I could ever want; a cozy soundtrack, adorable pixel graphics, easy chill game play with no time limits, and being able to design your own house with so many options and themes for furniture and decor. I personally loved the game. The world feels really lively considering you can wander the streets, pet stray cats, pick up trash, and talk to people. Organizing rooms and enjoying the "spooky" anomalies was especially calming. The game motivates you to interact with the objects you are unpacking or organizing. That being said, it is not that hard to find the anomalies and such. Some may think that is a bad thing, but I believe the game is charming in that it is easy to do the task you set out to do and relax. If you are looking for a spooky game, Whisper of the House is not it. However, it is still enjoyable regardless. The game reminds me of the game "Unpacking" which I also enjoyed a ton!

It's a very cute decorating game with some fun mystery twists here and there. The gameplay is pretty average of this type of game, if not a bit limited. The pixel art is amazing and very expressive. Overall, if you like a game where you decorate homes you'll most likely like it. If you like solving mysteries, you'll have fun with all the secrets the game holds.

A couple of things I didn't really like:
- The decorating feels kind of limited. You can't change the color of most items and the color selection is very limited, even with the color picker tool. You can't really mess with saturation all that much and some colors come out very bright or very dark.

- Almost all the bathrooms were absolutely tiny so you are very limited to how much detail you can put in them. You can't even change the shape of your bathroom and are stuck with the walk in shower set up.

-The ending felt a little disappointing but it does wrap everything up nicely. So it wasn't a bad ending just a bit anti-climatic.

*SPOILERS*


- The houses you get as rewards near the end of the game are basically just theme rooms and you can't change the wallpaper or flooring. Which I find very odd, since you given these homes and not like, reselling them/renting them out.

I absolutely ADORE cozy games (and more so when they've got a little kick to them). Whisper of the House (WotH) is a charming and cute indie pixel art game where you work as an interior designer by helping clients settle in the town. But that aside, you also notice over time how some tidbits look and feel unusual and mysterious - creepy, even. 

Comparing this to Unpacking is a disservice to both games! While both are about making a home, WotH feels more free; in a sense that the player can place whatever they want wherever. Not only do you get to decorate people's houses as well, but also your own! It's an optional side that you can do with an extra feature of gacha on furniture by using "tickets" you get from completing missions and rummaging through trash (which is the best part of the game fr)

In comparison to Unpacking, WotH feels more episodic. It places value in each client's personal story through the way they want their home decorated in contrast to Unpacking where you only really look at only one person's life. Despite this difference, both games are outstanding in their own right and both WotH AND Unpacking are very deserving of praise for its cozy, comforting, and zen vibe.

Overall, this game is wonderful and if you're an avid cozy game enjoyer for room designing w really good graphic and visual design like me, you are sure to love experiencing this game as much as I did. Easiest 9/10!
First time playing something like this, and i like it it's a very cozy and relaxing game  >//<

This game has so much charm and whimsy to it. I initially got into it for the pixel art and the process of packing stuff away into rooms piece by piece until it looks perfect; but there's so much story and mystery to the game. The main characters have their own backstory and the game plays out beautifully as you find anomalies and charming hidden details in every shop and home you work in. Even though the day is passing there's no pressure to complete a project immediately so you can take your time to figure out where everything goes and interact with different objects for fun little secrets. I received this product as a gift but I would have no issues spending full price. A lovely cosy game to pass the time.

A chill and charming game with fun little puzzles. The art and sound design really set a cozy yet mysterious tone. It’s cute on the surface but has moments that feel surprisingly unsettling in a good way.

Overall, it’s a relaxing game with just the right touch of mystery and eeriness. Perfect if you enjoy slow-paced exploration and light puzzle-solving with a slightly spooky twist!

Whisper of the House é um jogo adorável e um pouquinho assustador, especialmente durante a noite com sua anomalias. O jogo em si traz 7-8h de conteúdo, as numerosas  80+ conquistas são relativamente fáceis de conseguir e a oportunidade de decorar casas infinitamente é sensacional, nos permitindo curtir mais o jogo de forma livre.  Além disso os desenvolvedores estão constantemente atualizando o jogo e consertando bugs, o que tem sido ótimo. Ouvi dizer que estão preparando conteúdo adicional e vou ficar de olho, aguardando ansiosamente!

O único feedback construtivo que gostaria de realçar é que eu adoraria ter uma escolha maior de móveis e decorações com a possibilidade de girar todos os items em 360  degraus e trocar as cores, porém ainda é possível ser bem criativo com os itens que disponibilizaram até o momento :)

Truth time... I LOVED the game Unpacking so so much, so I just knew this one would be right up (or is it down?) my alley. 

There’s something so deeply satisfying about unpacking and decorating each little space. Every room has its own story, and I found myself slowing down just to get things “right.” The whole process scratches that same cozy itch as cleaning or organizing in real life... but minus the mess, of course. 

I also love how much personality it has. There are hidden surprises when you interact with random objects, and a few cheeky pop culture references that actually made me laugh. It feels like the devs had fun making this, and that vibe totally comes through.

100 % done and dusted in 8 ish hours, so I am not unhappy.

通关全成就+全图鉴打卡

累鼠我了终于集齐了，整体主线时长差不多4 5个小时，但是后续找全成就和全图鉴又花费了好几个小时，不过整理收集癖大满足！
一开始冲着类似《Unpacking》的玩法来的，《Unpacking》是整理收纳类游戏永远的白月光，这个游戏比《Unpacking》更自由开放一些，有多条故事线，同时也增加一些玩法的变种，以及大世界的探索，总之还是很好玩的，如果《Unpacking》是9分，这个可以7分。
要吐槽的地方：
公告板任务做的很重复很无聊，而且对于做成就毫无帮助
仓库分类做的很混乱，不明白这个分类的逻辑是什么，建议增加个自主分类的功能
精心给某几个房间做了装修但素不能分享感觉很可惜啊啊啊，希望有个联网观看他人装修成果的功能，可以互相点赞！

最后希望以后可以继续更新和优化，多一些主题房间~
好玩，简直就是单机版皮卡堂，但是获取家具的方法比皮卡堂简单，我要爱死这个游戏了

一款很细腻的游戏，本高共感星人玩得相当投入，虽然实际游玩时长只有八小时左右，但可以说各种情绪都走了一遍。看到好闺蜜搬到一起住，我和她们一样满心期待，忍不住想象每一件物品在未来生活中的使用场景；穿越时空回到爷爷还在的那个家，各种物品与生活痕迹也让我想起和奶奶一起生活的点滴；在收拾荒凉的海边小屋时，看着它逐渐恢复生机，仿佛自己也回到了无忧无虑的童年（谁懂看到阿衰的救赎感）。整个游戏最让我难受的还是为爱猫的黑帮老太收拾遗物，不忍心一点一点擦去她和那些小猫存在过的痕迹，所以我想尽可能的把屋子里的东西全部打包带走，尤其是小猫叼来的小野花和小瓶盖，还有老人自制的猫咪玩具....（略），总之我是能塞夺少塞夺少了，嗯！
其实有些房间的收纳对我来说与其说是在帮别人布置房间更像在自己的脑海里寻找过去，每掏出一件物品就唤起了一段尘封的记忆。

После тяжелого рабочего дня зайти в эту игру ощущается как запах свежепостиранного постельного белья.  Все, что нужно делать в игре - кайфовать, медитативно расставлять предметы и кайфовать еще больше!

Большие плюсы, которые привлекли мое внимание:
1. Визуал. Приятная яркая пиксельная графика добавляет шарма игре про декорирование микро-комнаток.
2. Сюжет. Порадовало, что здесь есть пара зАгАдОЧнЫх моментов и даже концовка.
3. Атмосфера и таинственность. Меня покорил уровень с кладбищем и церковью, бууу
4. Интерактивность. Почти всё в этой игре можно потискать и пожмякать, сплошной восторг!

Небольшие минусы:
1. Нет перевода на русский. Приходилось иногда напрягать голову, чтобы прочитать описания персонажей или понять, что за предмет и куда его ставить. В игре хочется расслабиться, но инглиш порой напрягал (хотя я его более менее знаю)
2. Вкусновато, но маловато. сюжет, как по мне, очень быстро кончился, хоть и прошло 10 часов. Мне не хватило таинственности, все вроде как начали закручивать и тут бам, музей открылся, а там уже и концовка. ХОЧУ ИСЧО!
3. Гача. Покупка предметов для дизайна через гачу - подлость (особенно ради ачивки)

В целом, игра вообще супер, похожих на нее не знаю, очень порадовала, рекомендую!!!
game is so cute and has such a cool use of secrets and puzzles!! def recommend this :D
我覺得喜歡像素遊戲和可愛風格的居家布置會喜歡這款遊戲，超可愛!

Si estás buscando algo a lo "Unpacking" recomiendo mucho este juego. 
Es muy relajante estar decorando los lugares.

I am not sure I am actually engaging with all the content this game has to offer and I am STILL having a blast. A cute town, TONS of furniture (the creators must be pixel artists who love to draw decor haha), and no scoring system means you just get to sit back, relax, and be creative.
a very cutesy, cozy game with a "dark" secret

I loved Unpacking and wanted something similar, and this is so much fun! The quests were really fun and just challenging enough, and the items are cute. Loved the interactions, and the storyline was really cute. Sad to have finished it now, but there are endless decoration opportunities to keep me coming back!
I have been having so much fun playing this game! Its cozy, mysterious, the graphics adorable. Easy to pick up, hard to put down. I do wish the controls were a little better on steamdeck.

美术不错，流程轻松，玩法可以
就是内容少了点

完美的游戏 原价入不亏
love the game

This is such a cute game for those who want isometric puzzles of clean up and design! It's so relaxing and a great motivator. It helps my brain get into organization mode in my own home -- not something I enjoy, but it must be done. It's also re-sparked the artist in me to make these isometric pieces! 

Yes, it is a short game, but it has replay ability. I haven't yet gone through the whole town and I certainly will be playing this again. 

Thank you Developer for this wonderfully cute game! I appreciate the time invested in this work and I really hope to see more!
i think it is good. super cute

总体来说还不错的游戏，感觉需要更多的打磨？
会在游戏里加入各种小解密和小彩蛋还挺不错的，一些破次元墙或者是微微恐怖的小剧情也让人在装修收纳的过程中更有动力。

感觉还是有些部分像没做完！！主线的装修剧情方面有点戛然而止，走在街道上商店的提示不够明显（购买家具比较麻烦和耗时），一些家具的摆放不是很对称有点逼死强迫症（例如麻将馆的床，始终会漏一条边是空的）
总之期待更多可以装修的内容和更好的改良！
This is such a cute, soothing game. The art style is done so beautifully, and I enjoyed the little puzzles throughout.
喜欢

超级好玩——！
做家政整理，你可以找到都市怪谈，收获消失的爱人，童年幻想的玩伴仍在地下的海洋中等你，时光机外茂盛的花树下坐着慈祥的爷爷。各种层出不穷的小彩蛋，最后居然还有规则怪谈元素，太太太喜欢了！希望后面再更新剧情！
整理黑手白奶奶的遗物时千头万绪，她生前的一切我都想带回家，但是总有一些东西你需要放下。好在，她仍在你看不见的地方逗猫。
无目标的开放式家装设计实在不擅长，希望后续多增加地图、故事、彩蛋和npc互动~
cute c:
hao

Unpacking'i sevdiyseniz bu oyunu da seversiniz. Sadece oynarken bazı yerlerde biraz alanın yetersiz olduğunu hissettim ama çok önemli değil. Eşyaları yerleştirme konusunda son derece özgür bırakıyor oyun ama Unpacking'den farklı olarak dolapları ve çekmeceleri çoğunlukla açamıyorsunuz bu da eşyaları tezgahın üzerine koymanızı gerektiriyor ve bu da biraz dağınık gözükmesine sebep oluyor bence. Kendi evinizi de istediğiniz gibi dekore edebiliyorsunuz. Kasabada dolaşıp anomalileri keşfetmek de keyifliydi. Oyundaki minik bulmacalar da hoş.

I played the demo a while back and I am so excited for this game to be out. It is absolutely perfect. If you liked Unpacking, and haven't found anything quite right to scratch that same itch, and have just replayed it a hundred times like me... Get this game. I'm only ~4 hours in and I am already obsessed.
好玩的我一直在哭
很好玩，小小贵，里面塞了各种剧情解谜的小彩蛋或支线，音乐音效轻松解压玩起来像精神按摩，就是太短了后续能不能再更一些dlc之类的球球了！
Been enjoying it so far! It's fun to organize furniture, it's super cozy and relaxing. There's a bit of a spooky vibe sometimes. And I've been loving the small story it has!
自由创造自己的房间

可爱的画风，舒服的bgm，适合压力大的时候玩，可惜主线太短啦（差不多4小时就能做完）炼金术师那里好难，不看攻略根本合不出来> <

我也是托，买了三次了，质量非常好，与卖家描述一致，孩子们都特别喜欢吃，版型很好，面料舒适，尺码标准，不沾杯持妆久，橘色系更加显白，洗完也很柔顺头发也不油了，屏幕清晰，运行流畅，敏感肌用起来毫无压力，握感舒适不伤牙龈，每次炒菜都会放几滴，用起来和真人差不多，很舒服。很满意的一次购物。

Absolutely loved the demo and knew I had to buy it when it finally released!

Love the game so much! Will highly recommend it if you enjoy games like Unpacking and wish you could do the same for other NPC's and not just for the main character. There is such a variety in tasks you need to do (Decorate your own home / Unpack how you want / Unpack but the way I want you to / I have this idea with a few items and want you to add to it) which makes every task feel different! Not to mention the subtle storylines going on as well!

Only downside is that the main story with the pyramid feels a bit out of place? Might be cause it wasn't there during the demo, but the way it ties in to our experience felt a bit out of place (might just be me though, but I kind of thought there would be more to it based on how strange some of the 'glitch' interactions were).

I think we also get wayyyy too much vouchers for tasks (and too quickjly)! Let us grind and work for those furnishing pieces to decorate our homes! I do love that the gatcha furnishing stores prioritise giving you new items rather than copies of already-obtained versions (you can buy copies at the mall at least!) to ensure that you can unlock all items easier rather than it being a pure gatcha.
非常非常好玩，本来以为是个单纯的放置游戏，结果是个主题很有特点的闹鬼小镇。美中不足的是剧情有点短，结局通的太突然了，不过游戏画风特别好看，而且自由度特别高，喜欢像素风装修的可以考虑入手嘿嘿
Such a fun game! I just love to decorate and organize and this game is all that plus being cozy and cute!
I just finished it and what an amazing and beautiful game! I highly recommend if you like a chill, cozy, and mystery game! The ending made me a little emotional <3
Highly recommend. If you are like me and have played Unpacking 20 times and are really sad they aren't making another one, this is the game for you! SO engrossing and satisfying and fun.

If you ever liked games like Unpacking where you get to see cute pixel item by pixel item pop out of a box and then decide 100% yourself where you want to place them, all while being under no time pressure at all - this one's for you! It's such a chill and pretty game whether it's for achievement hunters (that sweet ping sound!) or for relaxing furniture collecting and room building enthusiasts! I really enjoyed this game.

It has a tame but still present unnerving vibe(?) It's hard to explain and I don't think spooky really describes the feeling and atmosphere but I would describe it as mildly disturbing in the sense you might feel a tad uneasy. This feeling is very scant and only really ramps up in the latter end of the game and i enjoyed it as it adds a layer of suspense. That said, the ending feels accurate to the story's progression but it falls a bit flat. Just a tad underwhelming and the plot of the game is very minimal.

Despite the minimal plot, I enjoyed the overall game because I love organizing simulators and it's art style adds a fresh and exciting look to it compared to most other organization simulators (the only other organization game that ive played that has pixel art like whisper of the house is Unpacking by Witchbeam). I like the customization but i feel it could be more robust. All in all, it's a solid game it just might not be as polished as one may expect as the devs are still finding their footing for the game, but I don't mind that as the gameplay is the main draw for me and this game definitely has some replayability for me.

A very cute pixel organizing game similar to "Unpacking", albeit with a background Christian bent, where "Unpacking" was made by a Jewish developer and had Jewish elements (which is unfortunately rather unique in the video game space). That being said, "Whisper of the House" was a bit more enjoyable than "Unpacking" in some ways, in that the quests were quite fun, it didn't crash (though it had a number of lag issues that looked like near-crashes), and it identified objects for the player to move around. It's also a little longer and there's more stuff to do, although that made it a bit overwhelming at times, and I think the game is more targeted at people who like to make cute house designs than people who just like organizing things.

One of my main criticisms of "Unpacking" was that I didn't know what all the objects you handle were, so it was hard to figure out which room was the correct one for them. Although "Whisper of the House" generally sticks you in the right room for whatever object you're given (with the option of switching rooms as needed, though this is rarely necessary outside personal desire), the game also not only names whatever the object is, but also describes it. The descriptions aren't always useful, but the naming is.

There are issues with near-crashing: whenever a character would I think leave a screen, the screen would go entirely black, and the game would very obviously lag. During the end cutscene, the game froze, and then jumped a couple seconds forward. I also recall dealing with leg on clicking things at times (particularly with the gacha stuff), which was frustrating. While I appreciate the game is self-contained and has no microtransactions while containing gacha design elements, like games like "Vampire Survivors", I found this pretty aggravating because it does the "Kirby and the Forgotten Land" thing, where you can get repeat items rather than drawing from a narrower pool. This was irritating in "Astro Bot" as well, where you could spend hard-earned money to buy junk instead of items from the remaining pool. Considering just how many items there are in the game and how many pulls you have to do on average for them, it's very silly that you can collect things you already have when doing pulls, especially when it has no microtransactions so there's no intelligent reason to keep people making pulls, other than that's just how gacha tends to work.

The pixel art is very cute, and I appreciated the slight "Stardew Valley" and "Gravity Falls" vibes, with plenty of clear love for Studio Ghibli. The game does feel a bit overwhelming in moments, with a fast day-to-night cycle (that admittedly doesn't do anything other than matter for I think one item), and a small deluge of quests you get at once, until you discover everything is basically optional and the map has a pin system so you can set markers for yourself to go to if you get lost. The freedom and sense of narrative is nice, but I did appreciate "Unpacking"'s more linear narrative.

I was also really confused, from a narrative angle, why the game keeps giving you [spoiler]homes to live in. By the time the ending rolled around, I'd gotten a handful of places to live in, on top of living rent free(?) in two different apartments, so I was a bit confused why I was meant to be excited about being gifted a house and too much stuff to stick in it, cute as the furniture is[/spoiler]. This is why I pointed out that the game seems more geared towards folks who like rearranging pretty fake houses than folks who like organizing, because this game design aspects seems to be geared towards giving the former more of what they want. And that's great for the former, but a bit underwhelming if you're not as into that part and just want puzzle-solving. I'm also a bit disappointed [spoiler]we didn't get to have a pet. The mysterious dog is never explained, and we don't get to keep the cat(s) that are wandering around. But I did appreciate the aquarium[/spoiler]. Additionally, while the town is nice, [spoiler]it's mostly empty. So the town aspect (rather than just focused on building to building, as "Unpacking" does) felt a bit wasted, since most of the neat-looking buildings and areas aren't places you can visit[/spoiler]. I also wish there were more buildings with [spoiler]people showing you where to put things. I get it defeats the purpose for some stuff, but it was satisfying in its own way[/spoiler].

From a designer point, storage was also quite irritating. The [spoiler]present boxes are very cute, for instance, but you can neither store nor even trash them, so they just filled up my basement[/spoiler].

It was also very weird to find [spoiler]when you click the cop car, whoever's in it says "Comrade", like... the  pigs are communists? I'm so confused. I also wonder why a police station that serves no purpose (other than removing an unhoused person off-screen) was more important than other town facilities, like a dump or a school[/spoiler].

This can also be very hard on your hands, given some segments require continuous clicking. "Gemporium" actually had an accessibility feature for this, allowing a single button press to replace multiple ones. It was frustrating not to see that here.

Generally, though, it's a simple little game, with cute designs and fun puzzles. If you liked "Unpacking", you'll probably like this. If you liked this, you should try "Unpacking".

Reviewing (mostly) every game (or DLC) in my library, part 383:

⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️☆ (9/10)

[i]Whisper of the House [/i]is a much better [i]Unpacking[/i]—but with a mysterious, paranormal spin. Suddenly you’re not just organizing a life, you’re uncovering one. As a cozy, home-decor sim, it hits a sweet spot where every dusty corner, mismatched painting, and forgotten trinket feels like part of a secret waiting to breathe. Also, it came out on my birthday, so of course it's going to be great :P

🚪[b] Pros:[/b]
[list]
[*] Cozy decor meets haunting secrets. On surface duty, you’re unpacking, placing furniture, helping clients move in or reorganize, and styling spaces. But there’s always a sense something’s off—hidden rooms, anomalies, whispers behind walls. That duality between comfort and unease is the game’s strongest trick. And then suddenly, you're investigating time travel portals, ghosts, and alien weirdness?!?! This game has more depth than you think.

[*]Creative freedom and satisfying aesthetic. This is the highlight of the game. The requirements are not as strict as in [i]Unpacking[/i]: most missions will let you put items anywhere. And let me tell you, there are so many items in the missions, and even more when you're decorating your (multiple!) houses. There has to be at least 1,000 items in the game. The pixel art is beautiful, as well. And so colorful! The pixel art is rich and textured, every lamp, plant, or shelf feels lovingly crafted. You can tell the difference between regular milk and strawberry milk.

[*]Charming characters and companion robot. Mark, your robot helper, is a delight. Their expressions, little moments of panic when you pick them up by mistake—those touches make the town feel alive. NPCs and clients are simple, but their quirks give personality to the spaces you inhabit, and their designs are very sweet. There's also a guide to everyone you meet, which is very appreciated.

[*]Ambient audio and soundtrack.The music is cozy, but with just enough wistful tension. It's charming for sure. Visuals and sound together make late-night decorating feel evocative. 

[*] Lots of fun and quick achievements that I don't think are missable.

[*] The UI (except for a little nitpick) is very good, especially when searching for items. You can sort by room or by function, and you can search things up by name. I wish, however, that the menus for searching items was bigger on the right side. 
[/list]

📫[b] Cons:[/b]
[list]
[*] My biggest con is that the description text over items is both extremely small and difficult to see. The text is black with a white outline, which creates a hazy effect behind the words. Sometimes the words blend in with the background. The text can def be bigger.

[*] Mechanics sometimes feel clunky. Rotation limitations (you sometimes can't rotate items fully), camera rules (you can’t rotate rooms), and tight spaces might frustrate your interior ambitions. But for the most part, the game is very flexible. 

[*]Translation and dialogue roughness. A few lines feel awkward or stilted—likely due to localization. Some NPC or client text don't flow super cleanly.
[/list]

Loved it a ton! Wished they had more houses/rooms to give me to organize/decorate! I liked when the rooms had a specific setting and the owner/character asked you for help organizing and placing their belongings around freely. The empty rooms and those rooms where the character specifically pointed you to where they wanted each furniture/item were ok but that mode was definitely my favorite. I also liked it so much that I got all achievements (I never do that) and one good thing I found out is that achievements are, well, achievable! compared to other games where there's always a few that are almost impossible to do. So that was a relief and a happy surprise!
The art and details of each item plus commentary was also delightful!!! 
I seriously Seriously loved this game.
It's short but sweet

I DEFINITELY recommend this game if you're looking for that Unpacking feeling - but I'll go even further and say: to me this game is better in so many ways. (but also very different and with a different purpose! not trying to say Unpacking isn't good, just stating my preference here!)

- First of all, the art is absolutely adorable and straight-up beautiful.
- You can walk around the map and interact with things in the city. It's so fun and the city isn't too big so it's not a bother to go from one place to another.
- You get requests from residents to clean or/and renovate their home or their work place, from duplex to bakery, flower shop, magic atelier... There's a good variety of places to decorate, you'll never get bored.
- There's no restriction when decorating, which means you place the items wherever you want!
- The stories of the residents are entertaining and cute. I wasn't expecting anything special but I was honestly surprised to find myself enjoying them and the humor of the game is all cute and giggles too.
- Daylies and side stories! And a newspaper system that gives you hints about them every day!
- There's mystery to solve in the story! It makes you want to discover more and gives the game a little more liveliness.
- There's a lot of items to unlock. The catalog of items is well-balanced. Having to buy them doesn't feel frustrating either because you get "money" pretty easily after a while anyway. If you like to 100% your games, don't worry, you'll be able to. Not too easily but not hard to achieve either!
- You get your own home to decorate as you wish, loved that part. And you don't HAVE to do it either, it doesn't change anything to the main story whether you do it or not so you can just skip it if you prefer to focus on the residents.
- You can enter any place you previously decorated and decorate it again. I never did it but I thought it nice.

Overall, I spent around 15-16 hours to complete the game and oh I wished it never ended! I absolutely loved it and I hope there'll be a new one, or at least a DLC.
I do think some details could've been better here and there (more variety in the OSTs and the ability to rotate all items 360°) but honestly, with the game being so good AND cheap, I'm not complaining about it at all. I honestly wasn't expecting that much content in the first place.

If you're hesitating to give it a try, please just go for it. This is easily one of the best decorating games ever! (at least to me :))

被我推安利夢物語の街，结果发现是完成度颇高的国产独立游戏， 除了很舒服的像素画风和音乐（特别是音效），还有一些探索要素，其肩负起了物品互动和驱动力两部分，这点不错，很厉害。
这游戏还有翻垃圾箱，撸猫和（无压力的）抽扭蛋环节！满分！

很多莫名其妙的地方有高自由度，我很喜欢这一点。

能不能把装修任务以外的家具部分也改成无限啊，食物这种只能一个个买还随机出的装饰，想多摆几个根本不够用

自由装修里的物件非常非常丰富，但是杂物数量占比大，相比之下大件家具就不太多，而且物品筛选交互有点麻烦。另外，抽盲盒是一次性购买50件家具，这让我对不断跳出的新物件很麻木。
支线里能看到试图讲温暖故事的痕迹，但是主线的逻辑还是让人感到莫名其妙……因为找到几间闲置的房子所以这些房子就归我了这种事也太成年人童话故事了吧？……

This is a really cozy organization and decorating game. I enjoy just how many items the game has to offer for decorating and how spacious the rooms feel. I think for it's price it's certainly worth it if you're wanting a cozy organization game, so I can't not recommend it.

However, I do have a few gripes about this game. First off, there's sort of a story happening, but it's rather unclear and the main quests I was getting through the mail just kind of stopped at some point without any fan fair or explanation as to why? I assume I just ran out of quests, but I would have thought it would be a little bit clearer about it, such as giving me end credits or saying it was the final quest. Maybe I'm not actually done, but I've spent another hour or so in the game and haven't gotten any more quests so I am unsure ahah. It seems weird to me to establish a system for playing the game and then abandon it. And the mystery is till pretty much unknown to me?

When it comes to the levels, I enjoyed them, tho some of the items seemed a bit too cluttery (leaving me a little stressed as to how/where I'm supposed to put some of them as a lot of the levels aren't given space for the clutter - such as one of the house levels gives you a bunch of kitchen items but there is only like 3 counter spaces and there aren't any drawers or shelves to put things into), or the levels seemed too structured, where they would just tell you where to put items or give you items that very clearly have set spots they would fit best, such as the shelves in the convenience store. I just would have liked to see a little more thought in some places to make it feel like we had more freedom.

I also don't enjoy that only some items are customizable color wise, and it's not clear which items are and are not until you put them down and try. For example, there are counters that you can change the color for, but the sink version of that counter can't be changed, so it won't match if you change the color. I would love some clarity in the game, maybe an icon or something next to the item that just says it's dyable. I think this is because the button to customize and the button to interact is the same, so for the sink when you interact it just turns the water on, but it's still a bit frustrating. 

There are a few other minor things that I didn't love about the game, and I will say that I am a little disappointed since everybody in the reviews has been raving about how good/interesting the story is and how fun the gameplay is, and I'm not sure it quite lives up to that, but it is a fun game and I'm hoping to play a bit more, in hopes of understanding the mystery/story. There are also a lot of things that I think this game does well!

At first glance, Whisper of the House is a cute game in which you navigate Whisper Town and help residents unpack homes and shops (and you can customize your own home as well). Yet there is more going on than initially meets the eye. The town is cursed. Someone is watching you. Locate and fix anomalies, and find out who's really in charge of Whisper Town.
I really enjoyed this game! It had some elements that reminded me of Unpacking, but I had a whole town to work with, and I loved decorating my home with items I collected along the way. A bit of a darker bend at times, but it lends just that little bit of mystery to an otherwise pretty chill game.

ストーリークリアまで１０時間ほど遊べ、ストーリーに関係なくお部屋のレイアウトを作ることもできるのでまだまだ遊べそうです。今後のアップデートでさらにシナリオ的なものが増えてくれたらうれしいなあ。

最喜欢的一间屋，是魔法师的厨房，整理过他和他爱人温暖的房间，以及归纳了许多珍宝以后，把他们的照片摆放好，背景音是古典舒缓的节奏，你像是时空穿越般到达他的工作室，在许多魔法药剂和收藏品间，发现了从镜子里到亚空间的方法...
起初以为只是普通的神秘蓝色空间，直到你用某一种方法拯救了在某个时空迷路的青年炼金术师（这里不透露方法，因为亲自体验忽然发现拯救办法的感受很惊喜），当他去寻找他爱人时，你点亮神秘空间的草莓绿色水晶球，这时整个蓝色空间开始下一场雪，是无法移动鼠标离开的时刻，神秘，浪漫，孤独汇集在此刻，甚至可以用晶莹形容的电子雪花，像是下到了主人公心里的，一场雪花
主线内容大概四个小时可以打完，体量算不上大，那些地图探索点基本就是走过去点几下，有悬疑元素但不多。报社那关应该初始就将里面的灯默认打开，不至于把所有东西一股脑堆在外饰。很多彩蛋我都是自己手动触发了再找到说明书，这一点很不错。建议打折购入

クリアまでプレイしました。
まず、おすすめしますか？を『はい』にしましたが、かなり人を選ぶゲームではあると思います。
自由に、もしくは言われたとおりに、さらには掃除もしつつ要望に合うようになどなど、様々な状態で部屋の内装を配置していきます。ちまちまと配置していくだけという作業に心地いい音楽。眠くなる人は眠くなるし、没頭できる人は没頭できる、そんなジャンルのゲームです。
私はちまちまお片付け作業が好き（ゲームの中に限る）なので、とてもハマりました。

そんな作業は大変楽しかったのですが、残念な点もあります。
ゲームの流れ的には片づけをしながら町の住民のそれぞれの物語をなんとなく知っていく？という感じなのですが、そこがどうもぼんやりふんわりつかみどころのない表現。
日本語化にありがちな意味のありそうで無い日本語が入り組んでおり、若干理解が難しいところがあります。
これは私の文章読み取り力が足らないのか、皆がそうなのかは分かりません。
もちろん分かる所は分かるのですが、クリアまでプレイした最後に総括して「なるほど、わからん。」でした。

ストーリーはひとまず置いといて、可愛らしい雰囲気と素敵な音楽。
そしてとにかく片づけ作業が楽しかったので結果としては買って良かったゲームでした。

I really had fun with this game. it’s relaxing, and I enjoyed every moment of exploring and solving puzzles. The hidden objects and renovation mechanics are both engaging and surprisingly challenging, which made the gameplay satisfying overall.

I played it on the Steam Deck OLED, and while it runs well, there are a few small issues. The text can be a bit too small sometimes, which makes reading a bit tricky on the Deck’s screen. There are also moments when you’ll need to use non–Steam Deck controls, so I occasionally had to rely on the touchscreen features to navigate.

One thing I noticed is that the renovation color overlay doesn’t disappear after clicking, so I have to exit the room just to remove the color box. Not sure if that’s a Deck-only issue or if it happens on PC too.

Still the puzzles, atmosphere, and relaxing vibe totally make up for those small hiccups. Hopefully, future updates polish it even more, and looking forward for more contents because it’s such a fun and cozy game overall.

I like it but honestly, I'm disappointed. This game is cute, it's fun to play, and the premise is really neat. The problem is right about the time I was getting really excited, gearing up to have to solve a mystery with the breadcrumbs I had found... it ended. No signs that the main quests were wrapping up, no final puzzles, nothing. It was just over. I was waiting for the next letter to come give me my next tasks (which I expected because there are a lot of buildings in the town and some of the quests are very interesting takes on the character's role), but nothing showed up. The mystery underscoring the whole time is wildly anticlimactic. 

On a more petty note of dislike, one of the houses you unlock to decorate is hot pink and bright orange with no way to change those colors. I hate bright orange.

All told, it's not a bad game: some of the tasks are nice and relaxing, the design is nice, and you can pet a lot of cats, but in terms of story it's really a letdown.

对于一个刚上正式版不久的游戏，我觉得不错

[h2] システム的評価が無く自由度高め！　でもストーリーはちょっと期待外れかも… [/h2]

とりあえず実績全解除までいきましたのでレビュー投稿！

【ゲーム性について】
他のレビューにもある通り、部屋の片づけと飾り付けが主なゲームです。
不評レビューにある通り、飾りつけや片づけ方に点数が付けられる事が無いため、適当に置くだけでクリア出来るものです。しかし、逆に言えばどこまでも自由に出来るので、人によってはその自由度が高評価になると思います。
実際私も、途中でゲームの仕様に気づいてからは自分に縛りを設けてプレイしていました。
例えば、30分以内に飾りつけてみるだとか、色数を限定するとか。とあるストーリーミッションでは全部持ち帰ろうとしてみたりとか。
他者評価やシステム的評価に縛られない、自己満足を大切にすると楽しめるゲームだと思います。


【ストーリーについて】※ネタバレちょっとあり
日本語訳が変なところがありますが、ストーリーが理解できなくなるほどの崩れは無かったように思います。男性キャラが急に女性口調になったり、その逆があったりしますので、脳内で補間すると良いでしょう。
ストーリーはミステリーというかSFチック。ゆるふわな世界観の中に、若干不穏な現象が起きるので序盤はワクワクしました。
しかしストーリーを進めてもこれといった大きな進展は無く、エンディング（とは思ってなかった）を迎えても「へぇ……思ってたより壮大な話なのね。って、ここで終わり？？？　え？？？」という不完全燃焼感。
もしかしたら分岐があるのかもしれません。暇があれば最初からまた始めて、全異変回収エンディングを試してみようと思います。

以下エンディングについて若干ネタバレ。

[spoiler] 私は42個の異変を集めてすぐ、博物館に入ってエンディングを迎えました。明らかに42個以上の異変があるのですが、まぁ……まさかそこでエンディングになると思っていなかったんです。
だってストーリーは別に何か進んだわけじゃなかったし。実はまだ序盤なんだろうって思ってたんですよ。起承転結の「起」と「承」しか無かったので。
42個集めて部屋を進むと、石板？みたいな物にいろんな説明（原案や当初の設定？）が書いてあったのを読み、更に奥の部屋に進むとこの世界を作ったっぽい？異星人？が現れて、この世界のことを説明してくれます。
そんでアイツ「天候と時間を操作できる力をあげるね。あとは頼んだよ。そんじゃね～」って感じでぶん投げてきます。
「やたら平和な街だと思ったらそういうことか！」という驚きは最初こそあれ、何か解決する為に動くフェーズに入るわけでもなくエンディングに入り、じゃあエンディング後でも異変を全部集めたら何か起こるかもしれない！　と期待して全実績も異変も解除したっぽいのに……何も起こらない。
それなら下手に不穏な要素なんて付けなくても良かったんじゃね？と思っちゃいました。
でも一応、まだストーリーがあると期待している自分がいる。
新聞記事にある人気のヘアカラー屋？というのを未だに見つけられない。もしかしたらもう見つけていて異変を解除しているのかもしれないけど。
たのむ、何か……何か変化があってくれ！！！ [/spoiler]

ってことで、トゥルーエンド条件がもしあるとしたら「異変を全て集めた状態でエンディングを迎える」だと思うんですよね。話の雰囲気的に。
意味深なテキストがいくつかあるのでワクワクしたものの、ストーリーはなんだか期待外れではありました。
ゲーム自体は面白かったというか、私の好みにとても刺さるものでした。
1530円のわりによく出来ている！と思いますし、今後アプデやDLCで掃除片づけ系のサブクエストや、色縛り系のクエスト、おばあちゃんの時のようなストーリー性＋パズル的要素あるクエストが増えたら嬉しいなと期待しています！

This is a game where you organise peoples houses or businesses.  It's fun for a minute until your realise you're the only person in town with a functional brain. 

Perfect Design - the townspeople love it!
Abysmal Design - the townspeople love it! 

In one house, I literally put all the food on the floor in a kitchen and blocked the access to the rest of the house by piling baskets, and proceeded to the bedroom where i put the washer on top of the box spring on one side of the room, then took my mattress to the other side of the room and put my shelves full of items on top of that. 

What did my client think? Outstanding work!! Mission Complete!

I guess I don't see the point in playing a game where I can literally plunk anything down anywhere and win.  I had hoped there would be some sort of ranking system based on how well you put the house together but its entirely based on just getting the items put down.

I suppose in this game I could organise homes nicely for my own self satisfaction but I mean if I'm doing that, I may as well do the work in my real house and have something to show for it.

In an increasingly volatile market, within which consumers are expected to satiate executives' greed via microtransactions and expansions, Whisper of the House reminds gamers that pixels do not have to welcome waves of poverty. You will not find a limited edition 1978 refrigerator with an exclusive vinyl wrapping for $1544.99 here, but you can head over to the appliance store and buy yourself an adorable, stylized fridge in a variety of designs. You get multiple residences to decorate freely, as well as gently-guided tasks tidying and rebirthing your town's businesses and homes. You can return to redecorate depending on your current, real season to get seemingly endless time in this sci-fi dipped world. Whisper of the House drips cozy decor, calming atmosphere, and compassionate tales, and it will provide mental sanctuary when you need most. Click one button in your inventory to collect all within a room, breathe, and start again.

A couple notes I had after completing Whisper of the House:
- The description of the cane in the hospital being "usually used by old people" or something along that wording is inaccurate, as canes are used by disabled people. Disabled people can always utilize a mobility aid like a cane, but old people might end up using one eventually. 
- I want to be able to buy mobility aids and other accessibility devices when first starting out, like purchasing any other furniture piece or food item. I want wheelchairs, crutches, walkers, canes, changing tables, talk pads, ventilators, feeding tube equipment, etc. in my little whisper of a world. 
- If customizing your character is introduced, introduction of choosing your character being in a wheelchair or wearing casts/braces to traverse the town would be nice! When I see equipment such as grandpa's chair lift and the hospital's I.V. systems, I feel like I am less alien in my real life, like I don't need to hide my equipment and accommodations, and I feel empowered. But I dream of a future in which kiddos are gifted an affordable, accessible game and actually see themselves alive, welcome, and normal out with the rest of their community.

Unpacking meets Welcome to Night Vale. A lot of cosy games are cosy activities happening in a cosy world, where bad things either don't occur or aren't occurring near you, but Whisper of the House is more sophisticated. Yes, you're helping people and tidying things up in a cute pixel world, but you'll finish decorating and step back outside into the pervading feeling that things are wrong, and most people can't see this, and only you can fix it. It's only very light supernatural horror but its inclusion really does elevate the game from a happy afternoon or two to something I'll keep thinking about for a good while.

꾸미기, 도트그래픽 좋아하시는 분들은 너무 좋아할 게임,, 단순히 방 꾸미는 게임인 줄만 알았는데 마을 사람들 니즈에 맞춰서 조금씩 다르게 꾸며야 하는 것도 좋았고 퍼즈요소들도 들어가서 초반에 지루한 느낌이 전혀 없었어요!  실제로 게임 깔자마자 풀로 7시간 정도 했던 것 같습니다! 아기자기한 게임 좋아하시는 분들은 정말 좋아하실 것 같아요 생각보다 스토리 속에 호러적인 것도 포함되어 있어서 놀라긴 했는데 못 볼 만큼 심각한 수준은 아니라서 감안하고 플레이하시면 좋을 것 같고 개인적으로 꾸미는 게임을 너무 좋아해서 스토리가 다 진행된 후에도 즐겁게 플레이 할 것 같습니다! 저는 평가중에 남겨주신 한글패치 링크 따라 들어가서 다운받아 했고, 기본 게임에는 정식 한글판이 없어서 아쉽긴 한데 유저한글패치로도 충분히 즐기고 있으니 다운받아 해보시길! 귀여운 게임입니다! 이번에 할인할때 사서 저는 정말 만족해용~

What an incredible game! 
I do not believe I have written a review before, but I couldn't help myself.
15 hours into this game and I feel like there is still so much more to do. I love myself a cozy game where you can just decorate and feel good and this game gives exactly that. I did not expect so much customization and details and it does go beyond the typical point and place. There is a mystery story to the game, homes to decorate freely as you please, plentiful catalog of items to select from and unique game play within the game play. I may be a bit sucked into the game right now.
My warning is to set time aside to play, because you might catch yourself playing for hours straight just arranging and decorating. I absolutely recommend to players that enjoyed "Animal Crossing", "Unpacking" "Disney Dreamlight Valley" or "Stardew Valley", as it carries different vibes from each game.

耗完！！期待后面的更新！
每个委托都有自己的小故事，而且装修完之后会有小人在里面生活，成就感满满！
自由度很高，除了一个关卡会限定全部位置，少部分关卡设置主要物品位置其他都可以自己搞。大部分物品都有一段小故事或者介绍，妈妈再也不用担心我会认不出是什么东西了。而且没有时间、体力限制，角色可以睡觉但是不是必须（玩了八个小时完全没睡！），商店24小时营业。可以尽情装修发挥想象！
[strike]虽然不能自由选择墙纸地面的装修[/strike]（我少玩了五毛钱的），可以切换房型
还有大家喜闻乐见的翻箱倒柜环节，可以随机获得家具
除了在保存时卡顿有点严重，家具的查找还能优化以外，其他都很不错，推荐！

I was pretty apprehensive about this game. My expectations were linked to unpacking -- which I did enjoy but eventually found boring and quite short.

I felt a tad nervous starting this game and expecting to refund it -- worrying I was wasting my time, despite the recommendations. [i] I was SO wrong! [/i]

Yes you are unpacking people's houses, but they add amazing puzzles to keep it entertaining. There is a story where it actually caught me quite off guard and scared me a bit - LOL!

[b] Semi- Early Game Spoilers (not SUPER crazy spoilers - just fun to find/ figure out on your own) [/b]
[spoiler] What actually got me what the Alchemist house. Needing to find pages, herbs, and other items to make potions really caught my attention, leading to opening a hidden portal. Of course the hidden crack in the wall at Luma's scared the Sh*t out of me BAD, lol. [/spoiler]

Overall, if you like organizing, puzzles, and a bit of mystery - buy it! I spent so much time on it for the first run through, which is SO rare for me! I truly enjoyed this game a lot, and plan to keep playing, NO refund needed. ;)

装修玩法作为大头的游戏，box的分类和家具的品类还是少了点，虽然更新后分类变好了有点像sims4，但还是没什么去装修自己的房子的动力所以主线做完就卸载了。
不过个人觉得碎片化的特异类剧情量是刚好的，不像前排评论一样觉得剧情断，毕竟不是主角的人生主线。但是随着剧情的推进场外信息量反而越来越少了，后期路人没有和角色变强关联的新对话，也几乎没有新的新闻什么的了，礼物会堆在一个可能很久没回去过的家，感觉就是游戏突然的就把玩家抛弃了。
还是很优秀的游戏，手感，正反馈都打磨的挺精致，也没有设计卡人的数值，在这个品类里算是很不错了，能感受到制作组对满足和休闲度的重视远大于想给玩家挑战性。但是装修作为主线的个人成就感还是要再加强很多倍才行。

A delight of a game! 

It feels like a mix between Unpacking and House Flipper that’s visually styled like Stardew (all of which I l o v e). 
Truly feels like a trap if this is your kinda game, you simply can’t get out.. just one more task.. one more (until it’s 4 a.m.). 
The game is really well made, the pixel art style is top-tier. It’s cozy and satisfying. 

The only 2 complaints I have are: 
1) As far as my research goes, there’s no option to change the layout of your houses, make them bigger and in some you can’t even change the wallpaper which is a bit frustrating in a game that focuses on customization and decoration;
2) The story is short and feels a bit rushed. 

I feel like if the devs added more options for customization, added more furniture styles and expanded the story, that would truly be a game that many would come back to for years to come.

There is legitimately so much room here to expand and add new content that I truly wish they won’t let this opportunity to fizzle out.

This game scratches an itch I didn't even know I had. 

I love games with creative elements, especially when you have your own base or room to organize and design in some way. A lot of games have this now, but it's rarely ever part of the core game play. Then you have other games where creativity and design *are* part of the core game play, but those tend to feel more like casual sandboxes.

This game figured out how to do both in a way that feels like a creative sandbox that's also engaging and objective-based, with an intriguing mystery unfolding at the same time. One minute, you're cleaning and organizing a house for a new tenant. The next minute, you stumble upon a secret [spoiler] alchemy workshop where you learn how to mix a potion to traverse the astral plane into another dimension [/spoiler]. You know, standard decorating stuff. 

The library of items to decorate with is very large (much more than vanilla SIms these days). There are several themed sets that can all be mixed and matched to your hearts desire. You purchase items from shops via "mystery boxes" that contain a mix of common and rare items. So, it's a little tricky to get a full matching set right away, but you can recycle items you don't want for currency, and there are many ways to get more money to buy more stuff, or even to find new items out in the world. 

No objective is ever exactly the same. It's a very engaging experience. The world is immersive. The attention to detail is [chef's kiss]. The sound design and music are great. This game is a new favorite genre of mine, and it's in a league of it's own. I really hope they add to it with DLC or make a sequel in the future. For now, I'm enjoying the heck of this.

As others have said, this gives off very similar vibes to Unpacking. And it also adds additional elements and a story that make this game fun.
Don't expect this to be the best game ever - but for the price, it's a nice, chill way to unwind.

The game is full of small mysteries and things to solve and also you get to decorate other people's houses (and your own). The story is good and there are so many fun characters you get to talk to! I know the word "cozy" gets thrown around a lot but this game is so cozy (and a bit spooky :P). Also a really good game to play when you are sick at home lol.
棒棒棒

this game really helps me unwind and decompress so much after any stressful week, it's basically a free therapy taking on the immersive, somewhat wholesome missions on helping out the townsfolk arranging the furniture and redecorating their houses without any single deadlines. no time limit also means more encouragement for me to explore the buildings and houses i got assigned to.

for item collectors or perfectionists - eventhough there's only a tiny bit of gacha required to get all sets of furniture, it's so minimal that you're more than often finish your collection sooner than you think, and the game is quite generous in giving away "vouchers", which is basically the game's currency in order to purchase anything in-game. 80-90% of the game is the decoration gameplay itself, and the rest is optional content; either taking on additional, unlimited decoration missions (i.e creating your showroom from scratch with your own personal touches) and rolling for easy-to-get exclusive furnitures/buying the ones already available in the mall.

again, very much enjoying this game, and loving the cute, hopeful little plotlines among the townsfolk. it scratches the itch in my ADHD brain nicely. :)

八小时做完全成就了，本AAA王牌家政工的职业生涯暂告一段落，希望制作组多多更新让我再续辉煌。
简评一下，很纯粹的轻松治愈整理收纳小游戏，没啥硬伤，经常被说的体量小玩完了我觉得还行，剧情虽短，细节很多，主线里的大多数物品都有介绍，可以透过文字了解角色更多故事，相信玩过unpacking且喜欢的也会喜欢这一作，而且这部自由度更高，随着主线推进，会得到很多套房子和家具自由装修（在此感叹一下这世界观下的房子是真的不值钱啊，随随便便就送） 中期开始也有日常任务可以接，装修各种小房子。
个人角度可以打九分，一份扣在让制作组不要骄傲多多更新。
推荐给所有整理收纳类游戏爱好者。

But most importantly, would I recommend this game? Yes, but not to everyone. If you want a challenge, don't buy it. If you want a chill sims-like game with a sprinkle of mystery, then go for it!

i'm fairly sure if you play this game without stopping to decorate the houses you gain along the way- which mind you, i only decorated two of which- your gameplay time would be shorter then 8 hours :]

10/10 Not what you think it is
- Goodman Goodhouse, Mayor of Whisper Town.

首先 无折扣的话目前这个价格肯定偏高了，主线可以说非常短，后面基本就是喜欢装修的人的自由设计时间。目前来说家具里国风类很少，户型也是，也不说搭建一个园林吧但是连搭一个大一点的古风屋子都有点困难。然后就是地图上的巴士站太鸡肋了，起了站点名字但是又不在地图上高亮显示是哪个站点，只能一个一个试。loft户型那个一层的角落里的墙放不上去东西，虽然说本来也看不见但是装修的时候就很膈应。最后更新以后那个仓库里的搜索栏关不了，我习惯用wsad移动画面，现在老是莫名其妙在搜索栏输入，手感比之前烂多了。

여러 사람들의 집 안 가구를 배치해 주고 청소를 해 주는 인테리어 담당자가 되어, 주민들과 친해지며 마을의 비밀을 알아가는 이야기.

Whisper of the House 는 Whisper 마을의 하우스키퍼로 취직한 이후 여러 명의 주민들을 만나 그들의 부탁 (집 안 가구 배치를 적절하게 해주기) 를 들어주고 각 인물들에 대해 가볍게 알아간다는 기본적인 스토리라인에, 마을 전체를 이곳저곳 돌아다니며 찾을 수 있는 기묘한 물체들을 하나하나 해체하면서 마을 속 숨겨진 비밀들을 찾는 기묘한 이야기가 겹쳐져 있는 게임이다. 전자의 경우, "어 이거 뭔가 익숙하네?" 라고 느껴질 수 있는 게임플레이인데, 약 4년 전 출시한 Unpacking 을 플레이 해 봤다면 매우 익숙한 맛을 여기서 다시 한 번 맛볼 수 있다. 여러 가지 자잘한 가구들과 사물들을 하나씩 꺼내서 집 안에 차곡차곡 쌓아가는 재미와, 비좁은 공간 안에 원하는 대로 가구들을 배치하다가 게임과 싸우는 나 자신을 보게 될 것이다. 사실 이 과정을 순수하게 재미로 따진다면 그렇게 재미와 도파민이 넘쳐나는 게임은 아니다. 몇백 개의 디지털 오브젝트들을 마우스로 눌러 드래그하면서 배치하는 과정을 재미있게 느끼는 사람은 많지 않지만, 재미의 범위를 좀 더 넓게 잡아서 "머리를 비우고 무아지경의 상태에 빠져서 화면 속 물체들을 정렬하는 데서 오는 편안함" 을 재미의 일부분으로 볼 수 있다면, 이런 유형의 게임 (직소 퍼즐 맞추기, 생활 시뮬레이션 게임 플레이 등등) 을 재미있게 할 사람은 많을 것이다. 그런 의미에서, Unpacking 도 그렇고 이 게임도 그렇고 솔직히 말해서 사이버 노동 게임에 가까운 게임플레이를 보여주고 있지만, 여러 집 안 가구 배치를 하는 데에서 재미와 편안함을 느낄 수 있었고, 비록 특정 사이드 컨텐츠 (게임 내 재화를 벌 수 있는 반복 퀘스트로, 사람들이 원하는 테마의 방을 만들어 주면 되는 퀘스트가 있는데, 개인적으로 메인 스토리까지 딱 즐기는 데서 게임이 줄 수 있는 편안함 게이지를 모두 채웠기 때문에, 게임플레이가 노동으로 느껴지는 역치점을 넘기기 전에 엔딩을 보고 게임을 껐다) 를 즐기지는 않았으나 엔딩을 볼 때까지 게임플레이가 너무 불쾌하게 느껴지지 않았다. 만약 이 평가를 쓰는 사람의 Unpacking 평가를 읽었다면 "아니 그 게임은 비추천을 남겼으면서 이 게임은 왜 추천을 남겼냐?" 라고 물어볼 수 있다. 그 이유는 사실 게임의 세부적인 구조의 차이에서 볼 수 있는데, Unpacking 의 경우 게임의 처음부터 끝까지 한 인물이 나이를 먹으면서 이사하는 과정을 그린 게임이라, 좋게 보면 스토리라인이 일관성을 지니고 있어서 괴랄하게 느껴질 부분이 없다는 장점이 있고, 나쁘게 보면 스토리가 정말 잔잔하다 못해 아무런 파동이 느껴지지 않는 호수를 관찰하는 기분이라 스토리 면에서는 꽤 지루했다는 단점이 있다. 왜 캐주얼 힐링 게임에서 스토리 이야기를 꺼내냐고 할 수 있지만, 게임플레이가 짐을 풀고 가구를 정리하는 큰 구조에서 절대로 벗어나지 않으며 모든 스테이지가 너무 비슷비슷하게 느껴지기 때문에 스토리라도 멱살잡고 플레이어의 관심을 잡아야 하는 게임이었는데 이를 실패해서, 게임을 하는 과정 및 게임 속 품은 이야기가 재미있게 느껴지지 않았다.

Whisper of the House 는 게임플레이 (짐을 정리하는 과정) 및 스토리 면에서 나 같이 집중력이 적은 사람들이 중간에 게임을 접지 않도록 어느 정도 조치를 취한 모습을 보이는데, 게임플레이 면의 경우 짐을 정리하는 레벨들이 이 게임의 핵심이기는 하지만, 소소하게 숨겨져 있는 퍼즐들을 풀어 나가는 재미 및 숨겨진 물체 / 상호작용들을 찾는 재미가 있었고, 각각의 스테이지가 자신만의 개성을 자랑할 수 있도록 스테이지 별 테마 및 가구들을 다양하게 배치해 두었다. 특히 마음에 들었던 건 해변가에 있는 오두막이었는데, 바다 테마의 벽지와 가구들을 보면서 "나도 저런 집에 살고 싶다 .... " 라는 생각이 저절로 들게 되었다. 비록 여러 가지 테마를 배치하기 위해 비현실적인 설정들 - 두 번째 스테이지를 완료하면 마법과 관련된 집 정리 스테이지가 나오기에, 진짜 현실적인 게임을 기대했다면 좀 당황할 수 있다 - 이 들어가 있다는 게 마음에 안 드는 사람들도 있을 것이지만, 개인적으로는 그렇게 마음에 걸리는 특징은 아니었다. 스토리 또한 여러 가지 인물들을 만나고 그들을 도와주는 게 주요 내용이며, 물론 스토리 기반 게임들에 비하면 내용이 많이 부실한 건 사실이지만 그래도 다양한 사연 및 특징을 지닌 인물들을 넣어 두어서, 하나의 사연을 충분히 맛 봤다고 생각하면 또 새로운 스테이지를 던져 주면서 게임의 분위기를 지속적으로 바꾸고 환기한다는 장점이 있다. 특이하게도 게임 내 엔드 컨텐츠는 마을을 탐험하는 게 아니라 내 집을 꾸미는 것 및 모든 가구 / 오브젝트를 찾는 것인데, 후자의 경우는 게임을 진행하다 보면 얻을 수 있는 게임 내 재화를 이용해 뽑기를 하여서 여러 가지 가구들을 모을 수 있고, 생각보다 그 종류가 매우 많아서 모든 가구를 찾는 건 솔직히 말해 이 게임에 애정이 넘치치 않는 이상 적당히 절반 정도만 모으고 그 이상은 손이 가지 않을 것이다. 전자의 경우, 게임을 많이 진행하면 무려 나만의 집을 선물받게 되고 온갖 가구들을 같이 선물로 받는데, 직접 하다가 상자 안 자잘한 가구들이 너무 많아서 중간에 그만두고 얌전히 스토리나 진행하려고 나왔지만, 이런 장르의 게임플레이에 환장하는 사람이라면 몇 시간 정도는 그냥 태울 수 있는 컨텐츠다. 아무튼, Unpacking 과 비교해서 무엇이 더 우위에 있는 게임이라고 말할 수는 없으나, 여러 가지 컨텐츠와 다양한 테마의 가구들을 보여 주어서 Unpacking 을 하며 느꼈던 단조로움을 비슷한 구성의 이 게임에서 덜 느꼈다는 건 마음에 들었다.

사실 이보다 호불호가 더 갈릴 법한 건 첫 번째 문단에서 적은 내용의 후자인데, 놀랍게도 이 게임의 숨겨져 있는 스토리라인은 일상물과는 거리가 좀 먼 스토리라인이며, 이를 해금하기 위해 (엔딩을 보기 위해) 찾아야 하는 물체들 또한 그렇게 평범한 물체들은 아니다. 게임 속 마을을 돌아다니다 보면 + 다른 사람들의 집을 정리하다 보면 무언가 보라색으로 지지직거리면서 왜곡 효과가 들어간 오브젝트들이 보이는데, 이를 여러 번 클릭하면 왜곡 현상을 제거하고, 마을 좌측에 있는 비밀의 공간 위 숫자가 줄어든다. 당연히 과반수 이상의 왜곡된 물체를 찾으면 해당 공간이 열리며 엔딩을 볼 수 있고, 스토리 자체는 사실 좀 뜬금없기는 하지만 이보다 더 처참한 스토리 위주 게임을 봐 온 나로써는 "뭐 이 정도면 그럭저럭 넘어갈 수 있겠는데?" 라는 대가리 깨진 생각만 들었다. 비록 아기자기한 일상물 게임을 기대했다면 이렇게 스토리 방향이 미스터리로 틀어진 것에 대해 거부감을 느낄 수 있으나, 오히려 이 특징 때문에 마을 이곳저곳을 뒤지는 동기를 플레이어에게 제공해서 좀 더 몰입감을 높였다는 건 나쁘지 않다고 생각하며, 이 독특한 물체들을 찾는 과정이 너무 난해하지 않아서 외부의 공략 없이 자연스레 엔딩을 보기까지 필요한 수량을 채울 수 있었다. 특히, 이런 물체들로 인해 게임 내 숨겨진 다양한 상호작용을 보는 재미도 있었고 (예를 들어서, 두 번째 스테이지에서 반죽을 오븐에 넣어서 태워먹을 수 있다는 사실을 몰랐는데 공략을 보고 "아니, 이런 것도 있었어?" 라는 걸 알게 되었다) 이러한 왜곡된 물체들이 게임의 재미를 깎아먹는 건 아니었다고 생각한다. 특히 제일 귀여웠던 상호작용은 욕조에 고무 오리를 배치한 뒤 눌러보면 머리를 꾹 누르는 애니메이션이 나오는 것이었다. 별 거 아닌데 좌우로 고무 오리가 찌그러지는 게 너무 귀여웠다 ..... 


결론적으로, 아기자기한 가구들을 정리하는 재미와 나름 넓고 다양한 건물들을 탐방하며 게임 속 숨겨진 물체와 이벤트에 대해 알아가는 재미가 잘 어우러져 있는 잔잔한 캐주얼 장르의 게임이라 추천. 플레이타임의 경우 게임 100% 완료까지 약 6시간이 걸렸는데, 다른 스팀 평가들에 이보다 더 짧은 시간이 찍힌 경우가 많지 않다는 걸 생각하면 최소 플레이타임이 약 5 ~ 6 시간일 것으로 보인다. 가격 대비 플레이타임이 약간 애매하게 느껴질 수도 있으니, 직접 해보고 싶다면 가벼운 할인을 할 때 구매해서 해보는 걸 권장한다.

여담) 스팀 업적의 경우 100% 완료하는 건 1회차 안에 할 수 있으며, 이미 정리를 완료한 집도 다시 들어가 볼 수 있기에 실수로 업적을 놓쳤다고 해도 업적과 관련되어 있는 장소로 다시 들어가는 게 어렵지 않다. 스팀 가이드에도 100% 업적 가이드가 있으니 만약 막힌다면 해당 공략을 참고하다 보면 무난하게 업적을 모두 딸 수 있을 것이다.

Okay, firstly I would like to say that I do LOVE this game. It's everything that I found addicting from Unpacking and then some. I love the story and the underlying creepy vibe. It turns a simple cozy, organizing game into an expanded experience. I've played through twice now and am still finding hidden bits. It's the perfect game to load up after a long grueling day, and a great way to unwind. Well worth the few bucks to support an up and coming indie game company. 

HOWEVER; there are a couple things that I wish were different. The biggest thing being I wish that there was a way to mass select objects to recycle, rather than having to drag everything one by one. It's tedious and I would rather have a clean inventory to choose from. The way that the item unlocking works makes for many duplicates that just ends up sitting in my inventory taking up space. This is a minor inconvenience and doesn't take away from the overall experience, but I do find myself bored after spending 15 minutes attempting to clean out the inventory. I haven't hit a cap/max in storage (yet), but it's still slightly annoying to sift through even with the storage organization update.

My other wish for this game is that I wish there were more accessible buildings and stories, but I understand that this could be because it's still a new game and hasn't been fully fleshed out yet. It's such an addictive game and I want to spend hours discovering everything in the world, but it just seems to go really fast. This could very much just be a me issue though... 

This is my first ever steam game review, and I'm hoping that the creators take my recommendation, but I'll still be enjoying this game regardless! If you're into cozy, satisfying, and wholesome games, I highly recommend Whisper of the House.

Faz algum tempo que procuro um jogo como Unpacking, com histórias cativantes e organização detalhada de ambientes e, por mais que me indicassem certos jogos, nenhum se encaixava exatamente no que eu queria.

Whisper of the House conseguiu me entregar tudo e mais um pouco do que eu procurava, com vários personagens incríveis e histórias que se relacionam (estou falando do Ian!) e puzzles divertidos, que me deram mais vontade de explorar o mundo lindo que os desenvolvedores criaram.

Resumindo, esse jogo me prometeu quebra-cabeças tranquilos e me entregou isso, gatinhos fofos, trilha sonora gostosa, arte LINDÍSSIMA, personagens interessantes e um entretenimento absurdo.

Valeu cada centavo do meu dinheiro, considerando que eu ainda tenho que ganhar 10 conquistas com 17h de jogo e nem terminei de decorar todas as casas que posso, então ainda tenho muito jogo pela frente!

It's adorable, I think that's the best way to start describing the game. The pixel graphics give it that nostalgic feel but the story feels modern, it's very compelling to play, you get to want to know the characters more and more, making it a little sad once it ends. I want to keep playing it.

整体画风非常可爱，像素风温暖又治愈，但在温馨的画面下却隐藏着细思极恐的剧情，让人玩起来既放松又充满好奇心。游戏里有一些微微恐怖的元素和 meta 设计，给人一种“游戏和现实在对话”的感觉，主线任务也有棕色箭头指引，不会让新手迷路，同时可以和小镇上的路人互动，增加了不少生活气息。

装修系统是我最喜欢的部分。家具种类丰富，摆放自由度高，可以随心打造属于自己的房间，哪怕是小细节也能尽情布置。打扫和整理环节也很有趣，大部分垃圾或物件点击？会有标红提示会有红色提示标注，但有些小物件（比如水渍或微小垃圾）由于体积过小，得找半天。

剧情部分算是有点矛盾的体验。开头时主线紧凑，穿插着零碎的文本和细节，吊足了我的胃口。但没过多久，主线就突然“戛然而止”，让我一度以为是不是漏掉了某个触发条件。部分支线和解谜环节的逻辑也显得有点突兀，比如暗室里的人物来去莫名其妙。不过还没玩的时候我没想到会有微恐的剧情，刚出现的时候真的让我惊喜了一下。

在探索和互动方面，《呓语小镇》还是有不少可圈可点的地方。自由探索小镇的时候，总能发现一些小彩蛋，比如随机出现的猫咪、垃圾桶里的小物件、甚至是一些让人忍俊不禁的对话。虽然有些 NPC 的台词确实比较“空”，甚至给人一种氛围大于内容的感觉，但整体上，这种“白天跑任务，晚上瞎逛小镇”的体验还是挺放松的。尤其是和大地图上的隐藏成就结合起来，那种走两步路就能发现新东西的感觉，让探索过程不至于单调。

美术和音效也很好。像素画风看久了也不会腻；互动音效设计得很到位，家具摆放、垃圾清理的声音都有一种莫名的满足感。加上音乐氛围的烘托，整体代入感还算不错。

不过总的来所，《呓语小镇》是一款有潜力的游戏。它不像大制作那样完善，但在玩法融合、氛围营造和细节表现上都能看出诚意。我觉得花五十块钱体验这份治愈与神秘的结合，并不算亏。希望制作组能继续打磨，让这座小镇真正成为一个值得长期停留的地方。

I rarely write reviews about games, but this one deserves it. My first game of this kind was Unpacking, and it was so much more than what Whisper of the House offers. In Unpacking, I felt connected to the world, like I was uncovering a story through the items themselves. This game has none of that immersion.

The idea and concept are strong, but the execution fails. The rooms are overcrowded, you can’t not use items, and at no point did I feel any satisfaction while playing. Recently, I tried Hozy’s playtest, and I was blown away—the sound and gameplay were deeply satisfying. In comparison, this game just left me waiting for the boxes to finally be empty. Every time I finished a room, I thought it looked ugly. Not once did I feel proud of what I created.

The biggest problem is how mismatched the items are to the rooms they’re meant for. It breaks any sense of coherence or achievement. While I do appreciate the art style and the core idea, the game simply doesn’t deliver what this genre requires. It fails to be satisfying, and that’s critical for a game like this.

Я в захваті від цієї гри. У "Whisper of the House" можливо бути дизайнером, мерчендайзером і дослідником паранормальних явищ одночасно. Завдання часто супроводжуються цікавими персонажами і дуже зворушливими історіями. По ходу проходження будуть розблоковуватись нові будинки, а у продавців можна поповнити колекцію предметів для декорування, яких тут дуже і дуже багато.

[h2] 游戏详评 [/h2]
[h3] 前言 [/h3]
《呓语小镇》是由元气弹工作室制作的一款轻松治愈向的装修收纳游戏，游戏主要玩法为在小镇上装修，打扫各式各样的房间，但是游戏内核却又不止家政。游戏制作精良，steam一经上线就有96%的好评率也足以见得玩家对本作的极高评价
[h3] 背景介绍 [/h3]
欢迎来到呓语小镇，在游戏中主角将作为一位受邀来到小镇工作的家政工，接受来自小镇各处奇奇怪怪的委托，亲手把混乱的房间收拾的整整齐齐，在收拾的过程中可能还会发现埋藏在小镇的种种秘密，比如从床底翻出什么不可见人的物品，从一张画的后面发现隐藏的偷窥房间等等，在委托结束后去抽盲盒来收集各种家具，用这些家具自由的装饰属于自己的空间。享受从普通的家政工做到家喻户晓的传奇家政专家的故事
[h3] 推荐理由 [/h3]
精致的像素画风给人眼前一亮的感觉，游戏细节更是精致，有着大量可互动对话的NPC，街上的大部分东西都有互动效果，玩家可以自由的在小镇上清扫垃圾，修理消防栓，撸猫等等的互动，路边的椅子也像○神一样可以坐下，可以说是细节满满了，更是有着堪称海量的家具数量（1800余种）不爱装修的可能会没那么喜欢，但是对于喜欢unpacking之类休闲摆放的游戏的玩家绝对是可以无脑入手，首发价48.6可以说是相当香了
[h3] 个人感受 [/h3]
解谜和全成就都很简单，没有藏得很深的那种成就，跟着流程基本都可以轻松拿到，游戏的主线不是特别长，大概也就七八小时左右，不过在游玩过程中还可以解锁其他的住宅，可以按照自己的喜好自由建造，除去几个需要按照游戏设定摆放的房间以外，绝大部分主线的房间的摆放自由度都很高，这种就属于千人千样了，每个玩家装修的风格都不会一样，最后呈现出来的效果也肯定是千人千象。强烈推荐房间装修爱好者，强迫症患者游玩，非常值得体验

I'm so glad I found this little gem - what a fantastic and cosy play! The gorgeous pixel graphics are to die for, the world is charming, full and a genuine pleasure to explore. The decorating mechanics are deep and enchanting, with freedom of creativity as well as little puzzles to solve if you care to spend long enough digging around in each build. 

The collecting mechanics for furniture and items is intuitive and exciting, each time I unlock something new I can't wait to run back to one of my houses to redecorate around a new theme! The "jobs" are all unique and different in their own way too so that each build feels special and fresh, with so many different themes to explore. It feels really special to be able to walk into the shops you've helped design and then buy items from them too. The world feels so full and alive. 

The spooky/mystery undertone catches me off guard sometimes but honestly I would accept more of it, the cosiness of the game with the underlying hauntings is such a fun juxtaposition - I'm not quite finished with the game yet as far as I can tell I still have a few jobs to go - so I'm really excited to see what else there is to discover. I get genuinely a little freaked out at some parts (spoiler) like the spooky letters you get in the mail! But it's delightfully spooky in a sense that I want to receive more.

The devs also recently included an update that makes the UI of decorating so much easier by having the items easier to find in your storage/catalogue which honestly made it even more charming to play.

The one criticism I would have is that there's no way to customise your character past the two predetermined options - I would love to be able to wear the clothes that you can unlock or even just change the hair and skin tone would add so much to the game in my opinion!

However, that aside, this game is an easy 10/10 and I'm having so much fun with it. I will be devastated when I complete it. It's a gem!

If unpacking left you with an itch, this might as well scratch it. 
Similar unboxing mechanism and the satisfying pixel art style. There seems to be some story to it, that I still have yet to see. You can mostly decorate very freely, not including a few buildings where you have designated spots for some stuff. Spent way too long playing in my first time.
沉浸式搬家，在装修自己小屋的时候，时间不知不觉就过去了，等装修完巡视自己的房子，大大的满足感！

游玩过程中还是有些比较令人惊喜的点，但是不多，探索是新奇的，轻松惬意是有的，但主线太短了，主线通关只需3-4小时，全成就4-5小时，在博物馆集齐42个异常要素后游戏寿命就到了尽头。这会让玩家感觉到定价偏贵了，后续打折到20多的时候还值得一玩。
含有一些微恐悬疑元素，但剧情没有串联起来，更像是几个悬疑小品，互相不沾边，通关后索然无味了，没有重复游玩的价值。
Super relaxing game, funny hidden lore and achievements; 10/10 would recommend.

已通关全成就，一直在搞装修玩 ，仔细聊一下目前玩下来的体验
最近的更新严重影响了游戏体验，玩的让人特别恼火
1.首先是家具分类，感觉比之前更难找东西了，同一分类的家具在不同的房间里甚至内容不一样，还要换个界面找，分类太繁杂了...功能分类情况好点但用起来也没那么舒服，总之玩下来体验很不好，希望能优化
2.理想家的默认家具没法收回仓库真的是一个很让人难过的地方，本来就是目前体验各种户型自由装修的唯一途径，现在给你强制塞一些很割裂的固定风格家具，这还怎么自由装修，要么改成能收回仓库要么就快点把购买房屋实装...这下好了还得刷想要的风格，风格刷出来户型不喜欢不又得刷，纯折磨人
3.调色功能界面有bug，会出现调色后颜色不变或调色后鼠标右键点到其他家具颜色就跑其他家具上而本该换色的家具不变的情况
4.希望墙体边缘都能换颜色，有些能换有些不能换也很不方便，装不同色系的就会很突兀
5.不考虑出点新剧情吗？
6.灯光和光的图层问题，有些灯看起来会很亮实际暗得过分，有些又亮过头把周围所有东西都盖住了，窗户和灯的光即使被楼板挡住了也会穿图层发光，很影响视觉，希望可以优化平衡一下，以及希望理想家也加一个开关灯按钮
7.玩家拥有的房子除了初始的几乎都不能修改墙壁和地板，实在很难受…很大程度上限制了装修风格

以上均为个人游戏体验与建议，还是很喜欢玩小镇的，像素风格很可爱非常对胃口，可以说是做梦都想玩的装修类游戏（这下真玩上了），希望能做的越来越好！期待后续更新

Wer house flipper und unpacking geliebt hat, sich ein bisschen story dazu wünscht, der ist hier einfach genau richtig. Ich liebe alles daran, ein absolutes muss. Meine einzige Kritik ich will mehr von allem :)

¡"Whisper of the House" es un juegazo! Si te va el rollo de los juegos tranquilos y creativos, te va a encantar.

Básicamente, tu trabajo es ir a casas de un pueblo a limpiar y decorar. Pero no es solo eso, porque puedes mover y organizar todo como tú quieras. Y no te imaginas la cantidad de muebles y objetos que hay, ¡es una pasada!

Lo mejor es que tiene un estilo pixel art súper bonito y es increíblemente relajante. Además, a medida que juegas, vas descubriendo los secretos del pueblo, lo que le da un toque de misterio genial.

En serio, si buscas un juego para desconectar y crear cosas bonitas, este es. ¡Muy recomendado!

休閒小品就是讚

[h2] Unpackingとハウスフリッパーを足して２で割って、そこに少しの不思議と物語を加えた感じ。

とても素晴らしい魔改造だと思う。絶賛させて頂きたい！ドットも凄く良い！ [/h2]

[h3] ホラー要素と言ってる人も居るけど、どっちかというとミステリー要素だと思う。 [/h3]

いや、手紙はホラーか？ビックリするけど怖いと言う程でもない…と言う感じ。
ハロウィン以上の怖さはないと思うよ。チキンの私が保証する。

アンパッキングは１人にフォーカスを当てて濃い物語を荷解きから感じさせる作りだったけれど、
こちらはそこにハウスフリッパー味を足した事で物語性は薄まった代わりにプレイヤーの自由度と拡張性が上がった感じ。

特にプレイヤーが最初に訪れる自分のハウスは、ハウスフリッパーの事務所と大体同じもの。
設置家具を依頼をこなして貯めたお金で増やしていき、自由に部屋を作っていく。

Unpackingもハウスフリッパーも好きな私としては、大好き！以外の感想が無い。

しかも部屋が増えて複数持てるのでそれも良い。
落ち着いたら更にいろいろアイテムを増やしたり拡張予定らしいので、とても楽しみだ。



個人的にもっと追加して欲しいのは「Lサイズ以上のハウス」「部屋を仕切るドア付き壁」
Lハウスでもバスルームとキッチンを確保するとなると２DKくらいしか無いのでまだ部屋が狭いんだよね…。
一軒家規模のハウスが1つだけあるけど大豪邸と言う割には３LDKくらいでは…？
基本的に家のサイズをベッドや冷蔵庫やデスクなどの家具基準で見るんだけど、
やっぱ全体的にこのゲームの部屋は小さいと思う。もっとハウスサイズにバリエーション欲しいな。
それか自分で部屋を区切らせて欲しい…。風呂トイレキッチンは生活空間と別にしたい派なんすよ…。
更にはお風呂が普通の日本人だと浴槽＆シャワーの風呂とトイレは別部屋なんだよなぁ…。

壁に関しては、間仕切りや家具で部屋を仕切れはするんだけど、いわゆる明確に部屋を区切る感じのものが無く、
また壁飾りを飾れる仕切りも無い。区切っても最初からある壁以外に壁飾りが付けれないのが残念でね…。
これはワンルームじゃないバスルームとキッチンが別のハウスが広さ色々でもっと増えれば問題無いんだけど、
最初のハウスと最初に借りるハウス以外のフリーハウスがサイズ関係無くほぼ全てワンルームなせいで自分で部屋を作らせて欲しいんだよ…。

また、これもうちょいどうにかならんかなって点は、日常依頼。
これに関しては後程テコ入れする予定の未完成かもしれない。
と言うのも依頼内容自体は飾りつけから片付けまであるんだけど、中身は全部同じで空き部屋に4～6家具置いて追加でお題系列の家具置くだけになってて、依頼内容と噛み合ってないものが割とある。
いずれは依頼内容通りに中身も様々なものになると良いな…。あと部屋が無駄に広いのもだるい。日常依頼はS～Mのみで良いと思うわ…。

楽しすぎて、追加はよ！改修はよ！！！ってなってしまい困る。
寝かせておくほど待てないよ楽しいよ頑張って待つよ。


[b] あ、唯一のガチでの賛否両論かもしれない点がひとつあった。ゴミを漁れる事だ。 [/b]
なんか町中至る所にゴミ箱系オブジェがあって、移動してるだけでも誤クリックでゴミを漁ってしまう。
むしろ日常的にゴミ漁りしてアイテムとお金をちまちま増やすのがデフォルトなのか？ってくらいゴミ箱だらけ。
でも私はゴミ漁りしたくない。なのでまぁしないようにしてはいるし、それで問題ない。
とはいえ、なんでこんなにゴミを漁らせようとする作りなんだろう？？？という純粋な疑問は湧く。謎だ。

不怎么用动脑的游戏（褒），剧情和任务都很萌（各种意义上），制作组也能根据玩家们的反馈及时更新游戏，特别好，元气弹我喜欢你。
